Activity: Arrive at the hospital, log in to the system, and check emails. Prioritize emails related to EHR updates and influenza protocols.
Review the updated standardized protocols and tools for influenza symptom assessment in the EHR as defined by @clinlead-1 Nadia Silva. Ensure understanding of any changes.
Prepare my nursing station for patient flow. Gather necessary supplies, including PPE and updated influenza assessment forms (even though the EHR is primary, having paper backups is wise).

Begin patient assessments. Prioritize patients presenting with respiratory symptoms. Accurately document all findings in the EHR, including demographic information, medical history, vaccination status, current symptoms, and vital signs.
Lunch break. Catch up on news and social media.
Continue patient assessments and EHR documentation. Pay close attention to detail to ensure data integrity and completeness.
Review EHR documentation from the day to ensure accuracy and completeness. Identify any gaps in data and address them promptly.
Prepare a summary report of patient encounters related to influenza-like illnesses for the day, noting any trends or concerns. Send summary to Clinical Lead @clinlead-1 Nadia Silva.
Sign out and prepare for tomorrow.
